sub_topic: Calculation of coefficient of performance of a heat pump
message_1: A heat pump operates between a cold reservoir at 10°C and a warm reservoir at 40°C. The heat pump transfers heat to the warm reservoir at a rate of 500 J/s while consuming 2.5 kW of power from the electrical supply. What is the coefficient of performance of the heat pump?
message_2:
The coefficient of performance (COP) of a heat pump is defined as the ratio of the heat transferred to the warm reservoir (Q_w) to the work input (W) from the electrical supply.

COP = Q_w / W

Given that the heat pump transfers heat to the warm reservoir at a rate of 500 J/s and consumes 2.5 kW of power from the electrical supply, we can calculate the COP.

First, we need to convert the power consumption from kW to J/s:

2.5 kW = 2.5 * 1000 W = 2500 J/s

Now, we can calculate the COP:

COP = Q_w / W = 500 J/s / 2500 J/s = 0.2

So, the coefficient of performance of the heat pump is 0.2.
